channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: Google Suffers Setback in Fight Over EU’s €4.1 Billion Fine
item.description: Google’s fight against a record €4.1 billion ($4.7 billion) European Union antitrust fine suffered a blow after an adviser to the bloc’s top court said regulators were right to punish the US giant for abusing Android’s market power.
item.dc:creator: Samuel Stolton

media:content.media:description: The Google headquarters in Mountain View, California.

item.title: SpaceX’s Starship Explodes on Test Stand in Yet Another Setback
item.description: A SpaceX Starship rocket exploded on a test stand in Texas, adding to a series of setbacks to Elon Musk’s space ambitions that include return trips to Mars.
item.dc:creator: Angus Whitley, Kate Duffy

media:content.media:description: The SpaceX Starbase in Boca Chica, Texas, in November. Photographer: Sergio Flores/Getty Images

item.title: Eutelsat to Supply French Military With Satellite Coverage
item.description: Satellite operator Eutelsat SA struck a 10-year deal with the French government on Wednesday to provide service for the country’s military. The shares soared as much as 21%.
item.dc:creator: Kelcee Griffis, Jillian Deutsch

media:content.media:description: A ground network of satellites at a Eutelsat headquarters in Portugal.

item.title: Vodafone Appoints Microsoft Executive Pilar López as CFO
item.description: Vodafone Group Plc has appointed Pilar López as its new chief financial officer following the departure of Luka Mucic, who announced he was leaving last month.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Solon, Jillian Deutsch

media:content.media:description: Pilar López

item.title: Malaysia Files Suit Against Telegram Channels Over Content
item.description: Malaysia’s communications regulator has filed a civil suit against two Telegram channels over content that it deemed harmful.
item.dc:creator: Anisah Shukry

media:content.media:description: The Telegram Messenger app on a smartphone.

item.title: Uber Warns Hong Kong Drivers and Riders of Possible New Curbs
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. is emailing Hong Kong users to raise concerns about rules the city is formulating, warning the government could cap the number of drivers or vehicles allowed on the platform.
item.dc:creator: Newley Purnell

media:content.media:description: Uber offers traditional ride-hailing and services such as Uber Taxi.

item.title: LG Electronics Is Said to Consider Resuming IPO of Indian Unit
item.description: LG Electronics Inc. is considering reviving an initial public offering of its Indian unit as soon as September, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti, Baiju Kalesh, Rajesh Mascarenhas, Yoolim Lee

media:content.media:description: Visitors walk past the logo of LG Electronics during the 2024 World IT Show in Seoul on April 18, 2024. (Photo by Jung Yeon-je / AFP) (Photo by JUNG YEON-JE/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: Jung Yeon-je/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Alibaba Cloud to Start Second Data Center in South Korea by June
item.description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. will open a second data center in South Korea by the end of June, accelerating its multibillion-dollar bet on artificial intelligence and cloud computing.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding, Yoolim Lee

item.title: Alibaba-Backed ‘AI Dragon’ MiniMax Plans Hong Kong IPO
item.description: MiniMax is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong, people familiar with the situation said, in what would be a landmark industry debut for a Chinese AI startup valued at about $3 billion.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Julia Fioretti, Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: The flags of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region , left, and Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Ltd., right, in Hong Kong. Photographer: Yik Yeung-man/Bloomberg

item.title: Amazon Orders Employees to Relocate to Seattle and Other Hubs
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. is ordering some corporate employees to move closer to their managers and teams, roiling a workforce already worried about job cuts and warnings from the top that artificial intelligence will shrink their ranks in the coming years.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Soper, Matt Day

media:content.media:description: The Amazon.com Inc. headquarters in Seattle.

item.title: Chipmaker Wolfspeed Nears Bankruptcy Deal With Lenders Including Apollo
item.description: Struggling chipmaker Wolfspeed Inc. will be taken over by creditors including Apollo Global Management Inc. under a proposal that would put it into bankruptcy just long enough to slash billions of dollars in debt, according to people familiar with the plan.
item.dc:creator: Steven Church, Reshmi Basu

media:content.media:description: A Wolfspeed wafer

item.title: Meta Approaches OpenAI Staff, David Sacks on Genius Act | Bloomberg Tech 6/18/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the impact of the stablecoin legislation that passed the Senate with White House AI and Crypto Czar David Sacks. Plus, Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski talks about the startup's super-app ambitions, Zoox CEO Aicha Evans joins from the company’s new facility to mass-produce robotaxis, and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claims Meta is offering bonuses as high as $100 million to OpenAI staffers to jump ships. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Blackstone Snaps Up Stakes in Office Buildings Leased by Meta
item.description: Blackstone Inc.’s real estate business purchased stakes in two office properties in Bellevue, Washington, that are leased by Meta Platforms Inc.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Wong

media:content.media:description: The Blackstone headquarters in New York.

item.title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Reprieve
item.description: President Donald Trump plans to extend for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Lai

media:content.media:description: TikTok Inc. offices in Culver City, California

item.title: Trump Is Delaying the US TikTok Ban Again. What’s Next?
item.description: One of the first actions President Donald Trump took at the outset of his second presidency was granting a stay of execution for TikTok. Two and a half months later, he granted a second, and on June 18, he promised a third.
item.dc:creator: Kurt Wagner, Alexandra S Levine

media:content.media:description: The TikTok logo on a smartphone arranged in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2025. The Supreme Court signaled it's likely to uphold a law that would ban the popular TikTok social media platform in the US if it isn't sold by its Chinese parent company by Jan. 19. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Adviser David Sacks Says China Adept at Evading Chip Curbs
item.description: White House crypto and artificial intelligence czar David Sacks warned that China has grown adept at evading US export controls and is at most two years behind American semiconductor design capabilities.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Davalos

media:content.media:description: David Sacks, White House artificial intelligence (AI) and crypto czar, during the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas, Nevada, US, on Tuesday, May 27, 2025. The event will examine Bitcoin's evolving global impact, with speakers from education, policy, finance, and technology.

item.title: Microsoft Planning Thousands More Job Cuts Aimed at Salespeople
item.description: Microsoft Corp. is planning to ax thousands of jobs, particularly in sales, as part of the company’s latest move to trim its workforce amid heavy spending on artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford, Matt Day

media:content.media:description: A Microsoft store in New York.

item.title: Scale AI Rivals See Customer Demand Surge After Meta Investment
item.description: Alex Ratner was trying to get in a few hours of work after putting his kids to bed when news broke that Meta Platforms Inc. planned to invest billions of dollars in data-labeling startup Scale AI. Within minutes, Ratner, who runs a rival company called Snorkel AI, began fielding calls from his board about the chance to pick up clients worried about Scale’s independence.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Metz, Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: The Scale AI logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Thursday, Aug. 17, 2023. The head of Scale AI, which helps companies like the designer of ChatGPT improve the data that feed their systems, recently said the US risks losing its edge to China in the quality of data used as "ammunition" for the powerful new tools.

item.title: SoftBank-Backed Startup Harmed by YouTube Shift to Short Video
item.description: Just a couple years ago, Spotter Inc. was one of the most valuable startups in the booming business of YouTube celebrity. The company, which boasted a new way for social media stars to fund their operations, fronted millions of dollars to creators like MrBeast and Dude Perfect in exchange for a share of the revenue their videos generated.
item.dc:creator: Aisha Counts

media:content.media:description: Spotter CEO Aaron DeBevoise in Hollywood in 2022. Photographer: Kevin Winter/Getty Images

item.title: Iranian, Israeli Hacking Groups Spent Years Sparring Online
item.dc:creator: Jordan Robertson

media:content.media:description: American officials have offered a reward for a notorious Iranian hacking group, as the conflict between Iran and Israel is spilling into the digital world.

item.title: Amazon’s Zoox Opens Robotaxi Production Site in California
item.description: Amazon.com Inc.’s Zoox autonomous driving unit opened a robotaxi production facility in California in the latest move by a deep-pocketed tech company to expand the nascent industry.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: A Zoox autonomous robotaxi in San Francisco, California, US, on Wednesday, Dec. 4, 2024. Amazon owned Zoox Inc. has started testing its electric robotaxis in San Francisco's SoMa neighborhood.

item.title: Waymo Applies for NYC Testing Permit, Sending Uber and Lyft Shares Lower
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo has applied for a permit to test its robotaxis in New York City, underscoring its intent to operate in one of the largest ride-hailing markets in the US despite an absence of local regulations supporting commercially operated autonomous vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung, Davey Alba

media:content.media:description: A Waymo autonomous taxi in San Francisco, California, US, on Thursday Aug. 10, 2023. California regulators are poised to decide whether two rival robotaxi services can provide around-the-clock rides throughout San Francisco, despite escalating fears about recurring incidents that have caused the driverless vehicles to block traffic or imperil public safety, reported the AP.

item.title: Nvidia Joins $650 Million Funding for Gates-Backed Nuke Firm
item.description: TerraPower LLC, a nuclear startup founded by billionaire Bill Gates, raised $650 million to help continue development of an advanced reactor project under construction in Wyoming.
item.dc:creator: Will Wade

media:content.media:description: Nvidia offices in Taipei.

item.title: Intel Brings in New Engineering Leaders to Help AI Comeback
item.description: Intel Corp. named new engineering leadership as part of a turnaround effort under Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan, tapping veterans of Cadence Design Systems Inc., Apple Inc. and Google.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Intel Corp. headquarters in Santa Clara, California.

item.title: Justices Back Temporary Texas Nuclear Waste Storage Site
item.description: The US Supreme Court left intact a federal plan to store as much as 40,000 tons of highly radioactive waste at a temporary site in west Texas over the objections of local landowners and oil and gas operators.
item.dc:creator: Greg Stohr, Zoe Tillman

media:content.media:description: The US Supreme Court in Washington, DC.

item.title: OpenAI Is Phasing Out Scale AI Work Following Startup’s Meta Deal
item.description: OpenAI is phasing out the work it does with data-labeling startup Scale AI, cutting ties with the company days after Meta Platforms Inc. invested billions of dollars in it and hired its founder.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Metz

media:content.media:description: Sam Altman, chief executive officer of OpenAI, speaks at Kakao Media Day in Seoul, South Korea, on Tuesday, Feb. 4, 2025. Kakao Corp. and OpenAI have agreed to integrate ChatGPT and other AI services more deeply into Korea’s largest social media platform, another significant customer win for Altman’s startup.

item.title: Lab-Grown Meat Soon on Australia’s Menus After Approval
item.description: Australia has approved the sale of slaughter-free Japanese quail, becoming only the third country in the world to permit the sale of meat cultivated from animal cells.
item.dc:creator: Agnieszka de Sousa

media:content.media:description: Forged cultured Japanese quail foie gras.

item.title: Broadcom’s 340% Rally Has Wall Street Debating If It's Magnificent Seven Material
item.description: For more than two years, conversations about the biggest, most important technology companies have revolved around the same seven stocks. Now, some on Wall Street are making the case that Broadcom Inc. should be part of that discussion.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke

media:content.media:description: Broadcom headquarters in San Jose, California.

item.title: Xreal’s One Pro Are a Stopgap Ahead of True AR Smart Glasses
item.description: Review: The company’s latest augmented-reality glasses excel as an external display for phones, PCs and gaming devices.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: Xreal’s One Pro AR smart glasses.

item.title: Texas Instruments Touts Plans to Invest $60 Billion in the US
item.description: Texas Instruments Inc. touted plans to spend more than $60 billion on semiconductor plants in the US, making it the latest chipmaker to promote its domestic manufacturing ambitions as the Trump administration urges investments and threatens to upend the sector with tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Ian King, Mackenzie Hawkins

media:content.media:description: The Texas Instruments headquarters in Dallas, Texas, US, on Wednesday, Jan. 17, 2024. Texas Instruments Inc. released earnings figures on January 23.
